content: This section of the bill includes several miscellaneous provisions. It states that the Paperwork Reduction Act will not apply to any actions taken by the Secretary to implement the bill. The Secretary may appoint candidates directly to positions without regard to certain provisions of the U.S. Code. The functions exercised under the bill are not subject to certain sections of the U.S. Code, except for civil penalties imposed under section 9(b). Protected information in civil actions challenging actions or findings under the bill shall be submitted ex parte and in camera to the court and maintained under seal. The use of information provisions of certain sections of the Foreign Intelligence Surveillance Act of 1978 shall not apply in a civil action brought under this bill. Finally, the bill does not create a right to obtain access to information in the possession of the Federal Government or prohibit, mitigate, or take action against a covered transaction or interest. Any information submitted to the Federal Government in accordance with the bill is exempt from disclosure under the Freedom of Information Act.
